page.title: 06Churches 1100 celebration.
page.content: On Sunday April 28th 1985 at 3.00pm there was a service of Thanksgiving and Dedication in Largo and Newburn Parish Church.The service's purpose was to celebrate 1100 years of the Christian Faith in this area.1100 years before Aethernasus (Aithernie) and a team of missionaries came into the area and through the following years Christianity has been practised in the area. The service unusually involved clergy from all religions e.g Rev. K.McVicar Chaplain to the Queen,Cardinal Gordon Gray,the Bishop of St.Andrews,as well as local ministers. Other events related to these celebrations include a music festival a historical pageant,flower festival, competitions in local schools and a Festival Cookbook.
